p: The ion peak, with an m/z of 908.48 was assigned to the CHIKV E1 1-16 peptide, the same previously identified bound to HLA-A*03:01, HLA-C*01:02, and HLA-C*07:02 ( Table 1 and S1 Fig). In addition, the ion peaks with m/z of 511.00 and 849.92 were assigned to the partially overlapping sequences HPHEIILY and IILYYYELYPTMT, which spans residues 351–358 and 355–367 of the CHIKV E2 protein ( Table 1 and S1 Fig). The homozygous HOM-2 cell line expresses HLA-DPB1*04:01 chains. IEDB, but not NetMHCpan, algorithm predicted high affinity binding to this HLA-DP chain only for the CHIKV E2 351-358 peptide, and very low score for the CHIKV E2 355-367 peptide ( Table 1).
